abstract: Reducing the nation’s debt relative to gross domestic product requires steps to increase employment and revenue. Cutting taxes, tough talk and posturing will not solve the problem, an economist writes.

lead_paragraph: Simon Johnson is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of “White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.”

headline.main: Is There a Fiscal Crisis in the United States?
